messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Pagan Unschoolers
messages.msgSnippet: This group was just created last week: http://groups.yahoo.com/group/earthunschool/ Description This group is for unschoolers looking to become more Earth
messages.messageBody:
This group was just created last week:
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/earthunschool/

Description
This group is for unschoolers looking to become more Earth centered in their
daily life. It is a place to exchange ideas for ceremonies, crafts, altars
etc. This group is open to unschoolers of all religions but will tend to
focus more on Pagan beliefs. Only unschooling priniciples will be
acceptable, anything not fitting with unschooling principles will be
questioned. If you are unfamiliar with unschooling, please do more reading
on the topic before joining.

Tracy in MN

messages.msgSnippet: _mysticmamas : mothers  / pagan parenting/ witch / wicca_ (http://groups.yahoo.com/group/mysticmamas/) I think this is one of the groups I was thinking of.  I
messages.messageBody:
_mysticmamas : mothers / pagan parenting/ witch / wicca_
(http://groups.yahoo.com/group/mysticmamas/)

I think this is one of the groups I was thinking of. I don't think it's
specifically "unschooling" but my guess is there'd probably be quite a few on
the list that are :o)

Nancy B.

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Pagan Unschoolers
messages.msgSnippet: ... -=- Acorns, Pagan and Alternative Homeschool Journal: From the tiny acorn grows the mighty oak. There is a Pagan cover-school and website called
messages.messageBody:
On Feb 21, 2006, at 5:44 PM, CelticFrau@... wrote:

> I think there's a pagan unschooling list (or maybe it's pagan
> homeschoolers), that branched off of the Unschooling Discussion
> list. It was a while
> back...is it still in existance?
-=-
Acorns, Pagan and Alternative Homeschool Journal: "From the tiny
acorn grows the mighty oak."
There is a Pagan "cover-school" and website called Goddess Moon Circles.
Two pages with clear information and good links are Pagan Homeschool
Page and the related links page. -=-



I don't know if this will have lifted the links (I doubt it), but
it's on this page:

http://sandradodd.com/unschoolingotherwise



Sandra
